main event: A civilian radar operator tracked several unidentified targets on radar at about 25,000 feet, traveling at high speed, on September 29, 1959.
interesting points: The radar operator observed the targets on his radar for about 4 minutes before they disappeared from the screen., The targets were estimated to be traveling at around 2,000 knots., No visual sightings were made despite the radar observations., The sighting was investigated by Major Harold E. Taplin and presented at a conference., The incident was recorded as a possible equipment malfunction in the Project Blue Book files.
witness description: civilian radar operator with competence and experience
